title: Poor design implementation "for want of a silicone bung" this generic product was ruined
body:
Wife bought this after getting back into coffee whilst on a break in france..

She purchased this unit based on supposed thermal qualities keeping it warm longer, something our non heated coffee machine does extremely well as is.

The problem is this, metal products are covered in oil from the factory (whether you realise it or not) it is on the inside & outside to "help" resist corrosion, cutting, machining, etc.. so you have to wash them upon receipt.

I did just that then noticed that where the plunger sits there is no seal keeping moisture from hot liquid out, making it hard to clean properly, likely will always have oily detritus in the lid (hollow) whereas if a silicone seal or similar bung was utilised (a penny on the pound) no contamination would likely occur.

No idea how good the thermal properties are of this as when I saw how bad a design it was I clicked return (it is not of good enough / trustworthy quality to risk) suffice to say I read a good number of reviews & didn't see anyone else had noted the lid hole / plunger scenario that moisture would accumulate in & drip out of periodically, ...or worse fill up with if submerged in a sink or similar.

Will go back to the Melitta coffeemaker without the hot-plate which keeps the coffee fit to drink for a day without stewing it & turning bad / harsh.

title: Almost perfect.
body:
EDIT: after a while of washing it under a tap and then in the dishwasher on alternating days or so, it eventually developed water INSIDE the main body of the thing, sloshing around. I thought this might be a leak around the handle (which seems to be the only place where a weld occurs), but eventually traced it to a TINY hole around the rim, where the metal is very tightly folded (or maybe welded and then ground flat). Either from folding or grinding, they've introduced a hole in the rim. BUT, this might be just a flaw in the one I received, AND it doesn't really affect your use, so a very minor flaw in an otherwise great product.

Great, all-stainless-steel product, highly recommended over those ropey plastic-in-all-the-wrong-places Bodum presses, or those (even more plastically) its-fine-out-of-the-box-but-good-luck-with-mold-later filter coffee machines.

Plus, coffee presses are just better, from a quality coffee point of view, because they don't filter out the oils, where a lot of the taste and texture is.

Keeps coffee warm long enough to drink, especially if you're using this to make the espresso then pouring some and adding tap water.

NONE of the parts are plastic, which is VERY reassuring for something that a lot of hot drinking water goes through regularly.

Fairly high-quality construction. Easy to clean (take it apart and throw it in the dishwasher), and doesn't seem to rush or blemish in the dishwasher, so far, suggesting high quality stainless steel, too. Comes apart and rebuilds easily.

The only flaw I've found is that both the top handle/knob and the bottom nut can unscrew, as well as the filter parts. So sometimes when you're trying to unscrew the filter, the filter stays on, and the other parts unscrew instead. Awkward. ;) But nothing insurmountable: you can just screw them back on, and for the top knob, tighten it up more. For the bottom nut, there's no final position, so you just have to put it in the middle, then screw the base filters on again. I suppose you could argue that all of that is a testament to the simple, elegant design.

All in all, a great product. Fit for professional catering use too, if that's your interest.
